verses.verse: A Prayer <S%H8605><s%> of Moses <S%H4872><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%> Lord, <S%H136><s%> you have been <S%H1961><s%> our dwelling <S%H4583><s%> place in all generations. <S%H1755><s%>

Before <S%H2962><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> were brought <S%H3205><s%> forth, <S%H3205><s%> or ever you had formed <S%H2342><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> and the world, <S%H8398><s%> even from everlasting <S%H5769><s%> to everlasting, <S%H5769><s%> you are God. <S%H410><s%>
You turn <S%H7725><s%> man <S%H582><s%> to destruction; <S%H1793><s%> and say, <S%H559><s%> Return, <S%H7725><s%> you children <S%H1121><s%> of men. <S%H120><s%>

For a thousand <S%H505><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in your sight <S%H5869><s%> are but as yesterday <S%H865><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> it is past, <S%H5674><s%> and as a watch <S%H821><s%> in the night. <S%H3915><s%>
You carry <S%H2229><s%> them away as with a flood; <S%H2229><s%> they are as a sleep: <S%H8142><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%> they are like grass <S%H2682><s%> which grows <S%H2498><s%> up.
In the morning <S%H1242><s%> it flourishes, <S%H6692><s%> and grows <S%H2498><s%> up; in the evening <S%H6153><s%> it is cut <S%H4135><s%> down, and wither. <S%H3001><s%>
For we are consumed <S%H3615><s%> by your anger, <S%H639><s%> and by your wrath <S%H2534><s%> are we troubled. <S%H926><s%>
You have set <S%H7896><s%> our iniquities <S%H5771><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> you, our secret <S%H5956><s%> sins in the light <S%H3974><s%> of your countenance. <S%H6440><s%>
For all <S%H3605><s%> our days <S%H3117><s%> are passed <S%H6437><s%> away in your wrath: <S%H5678><s%> we spend <S%H3615><s%> our years <S%H8141><s%> as a tale <S%H1899><s%> that is told.

The days <S%H3117><s%> of our years <S%H8141><s%> are three score <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> and ten; and if <S%H518><s%> by reason of strength <S%H1369><s%> they be fourscore <S%H8084><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> yet is their strength <S%H7296><s%> labor <S%H5999><s%> and sorrow; <S%H205><s%> for it is soon <S%H2440><s%> cut <S%H1504><s%> off, and we fly <S%H5774><s%> away.
Who <S%H4310><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> the power <S%H5797><s%> of your anger? <S%H639><s%> even according to your fear, <S%H3374><s%> so is your wrath. <S%H5678><s%>
So <S%H3651><s%> teach <S%H3045><s%> us to number <S%H4487><s%> our days, <S%H3117><s%> that we may apply <S%H935><s%> our hearts <S%H3824><s%> to wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>
Return, <S%H7725><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> how <S%H5704><s%> long? <S%H5704><s%> and let it repent <S%H5162><s%> you concerning <S%H5921><s%> your servants. <S%H5650><s%>
O satisfy <S%H7646><s%> us early <S%H1242><s%> with your mercy; <S%H2617><s%> that we may rejoice <S%H7442><s%> and be glad <S%H8056><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> our days. <S%H3117><s%>
Make us glad <S%H8056><s%> according to the days <S%H3117><s%> wherein you have afflicted <S%H6031><s%> us, and the years <S%H8141><s%> wherein we have seen <S%H7200><s%> evil. <S%H7451><s%>
Let your work <S%H6467><s%> appear <S%H7200><s%> to your servants, <S%H5650><s%> and your glory <S%H1926><s%> to their children. <S%H1121><s%>

And let the beauty <S%H5278><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> our God <S%H430><s%> be on us: and establish <S%H3559><s%> you the work <S%H4639><s%> of our hands <S%H3027><s%> on us; yes, the work <S%H4639><s%> of our hands <S%H3027><s%> establish <S%H3559><s%> you it.
